page.title: 18ECOLOGY:THE KILMINORTH WOOD
page.content: This is the only real wood in our block.It is part of the ancient woods around the Looe estuary.It is managed by Caradon District Council and Looe Comprehensive School and it is a Conservation Site.There are nature trails through the wood.There is an ancient earthwork in the wood called the Giant's Hedge.This was a boundary around a Cornish chieftain's lands and it runs from Looe to Lerryn.The main tree in the wood is the oak.There are also ash,birch and willow trees which are native and beech,sycamore and sweet chestnut which were planted. There are also hawthorn,hazel and holly trees.There are spring flowers like bluebells,wood anemenes and primroses.There are also wood sorrel, cow wheat and enchanters night shade. We saw whortleberries(called "hurts" in Cornwall)and honeysuckle{(see P.19)
